intro: Squamellaria wilsonii, commonly known as the Wilson's squamellaria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
